1982 ‚Äì Presentation Night

Another cracker sent in from 1982 presentation night. Featuring Jez Hope, Alan Holden, Stan Heaton and Roger Bromley on the back row with a young Chris Bleazard on the middle.

Sadly, Further Good Friday Update..

Incoming players‚Ä¶

Lowerhouse are pleased to announce that the transfers of Phil Haggerty from Padiham, Marley Askew from Rawtenstall and the registration of Francois Haasbroek have been ratified by the League. Phil‚Ä¶

Second team friendly vs Euxton ‚Äì Postponed

The Second team friendly scheduled for Saturday 7th of April has been postponed due to Euxton having their GroundForce day on the same day.

1982 ‚Äì Holland Cup Win

Lowerhouse came ever so close to the title in 1982 coming runners up to Rawtenstall by a measly point. (League table here). It did however provide the club with its‚Ä¶

IMPORTANT: Good Friday Update

The heavy and persistent rain over the last few days has finally dashed our hopes of running the Jack Hayes Memorial Cricket Trophy 2018, our annual event on Good Friday‚Ä¶.

GroundForce day this Sunday!

Lowerhouse got to their first Worsley Cup final (known as the Martini Cup at the time) in 1980 by beating Rishton. They went on to be beaten by East Lancs‚Ä¶

For the second year running, the Lowerhouse historian and Park End spectator Paul Hargreaves decided to put some questions to club captain, Ben Heap. Ben kindly abliged to answering these‚Ä¶

The Cotton Queen of Lowerhouse

Final call for Wednesdays AGM!

This Wednesday sees The Annual General Meetings (AGM) of Lowerhouse CC CIC incorporating Lowerhouse Village Ltd which takes place at Lowerhouse Cricket Club from 7.30pm. All members are invited to attend‚Ä¶

Sad news ‚Äì Tony Benneworth Obituary

Lowerhouse CC are saddened to hear of the death of former amateur (1973) and professional (1974), Tony Benneworth in a boating accident. Tony had been in touch with the club‚Ä¶
